history.content: EECS 16A does not allow time conflicts. Typically if two classes have the same lecture time they are scheduled for the same final exam group. Here is a link to the final exam groups: https://registrar.berkeley.edu/scheduling/academic-scheduling/academic-scheduling-final-exam-guide-and-schedules/. Students must enroll into the class that does not allow the time conflict first and then the class that allows the time conflict.

I enrolled EECS16A and another music minor required course in phase 1. The enrollment center did not warn me anything and I only found out today through schedule planner that the lecture times for these two class conflict. I see on the classes.berkeley website that EECS16A does not allow for time conflicts, but on calcentral those classes have different final exam times. Can I still take both classes, since I can watch 16A lecture recordings? Will I still be able to remain on the 16A waitlist if I have a conflict in my schedule though? The music class is an important required class too, so it would be the best if I could take them both.
history.subject: Time conflict for EECS16A
